attributes.action: Launch an inquiry into HM Land Registry & introduce free tribunal for complaints
attributes.additional_details: The Government has a duty to obtain all records of complaints made to HMLR/ICR (who I believe are not fit for purpose & fail to take appropriate action in respect of many cases reported to them). The HMLR’s inaction leaves buyers & those who suffer encroachment to their property unprotected which can allow experts such as Surveyors/Structural Engineers/Solicitors & Insurance Companies to drop claims. The impact to those affected needs to be rectified. Introduce tribunals to handle complaints.
attributes.background: Government to launch an inquiry into Land Registry around incorrect title deeds plans & impact to new buyers. Reforms must be introduced inc. a tribunal for handling complaints. Incorrect title deeds can occur when an extension has been built onto a property/flat & HMLR title deeds are not updated.
